text: Here's an uncomfortable truth for new traders. The probability of you trading a small account 5,010,015,02550, even 100,000. The probability of trading those accounts into massive amounts of wealth super fast is not that good. Now there's a benefit here. If you have a small account, guess what does help you a ton? Given, incremental savings with a small account can have a profound impact on the total account value, whereas as you have a more developed account size, if you save that same thousand dollars that you would have in your thousand dollar account, you would have doubled the size. But if you do that on a million dollar account, it doesn't even move the needle. So for big accounts, we care a lot about returns. For small accounts, the first thing you have to focus on is fucking saving. The second thing you have to focus on is developing the skill set versus trying to make money super fast overnight.
